workshops.title: Workshops
workshops.content: Information about workshops held in conjunction with MITA 2025.

workshops/ccms-workshop.title: CCMS Workshop
workshops/ccms-workshop.content:
Topics For CCMS

  • Theory of Multimedia & Communication Systems
  • Nonlinear Devices and Communication Systems
  • Power or Energy Systems for Communication
  • Problems in Actual Systems and Empirical Approaches
  • Distributed Networks and Algorithms
  • Nonlinearity in Radar and Tomography Measurements
  • Neural and Biological Systems Based on Knowledge and Technique of Communication Systems
  • Electromagnetic Wave Propagation Theory and Modeling
  • Multimedia Communication System
  • Multimedia Signal Processing for Communication
  • Multimedia Contents and IT Convergence
  • Multimedia Information Processing and Systems

workshops/ccms-workshop/ccms-submission.title: CCMS Submission
workshops/ccms-workshop/ccms-submission.content:
Papers submitted to the CCMS Workshop can be submitted through the conference submission system (CMT) by selecting the CCMS track.

Go to Microsoft CMT

workshops/ccms-workshop/ccms-program-sch.title: CCMS Program
workshops/ccms-workshop/ccms-program-sch.content: CCMS Workshop program schedule will be updated soon.

call-for-papers.title: Call for Papers
call-for-papers.content:
Technical Scope

Topics include, but are not limited to:

  • Artificial Intelligence
  • Multimedia System
  • Database in Multimedia
  • Multimedia Applications
  • Graphics and 3D Modeling
  • Embedded System in Multimedia
  • Multimedia Information Security
  • Human Computer Interaction
  • Multimedia Contents
  • Internet Technology and Social Media
  • Digital Signal, Image and Video Processing
  • Multimedia Networks and Communication
  • Game and Media Arts
  • Virtual Reality

call-for-papers/call-for-conference-pape.title: Call for Conference Paper
call-for-papers/call-for-conference-pape.content:
Paper Submission Guidelines

  • Maximum length: 2 pages (short paper) or 3-4 pages (regular paper).
  • Format: A4 size, single space, double column, Times New Roman font (size 10).
  • Accepted papers will be published by Springer in the Communications in Computer and Information Science (CCIS) series.
  • Springer CCIS is indexed in SCOPUS, EI Compendex, etc.

At least one author of each accepted paper must present the paper at the conference.

Submit your paper via Microsoft CMT

call-for-papers/call-for-journal-paper.title: Call for Journal Paper
call-for-papers/call-for-journal-paper.content:
Journal Track (JMIS)

We are pleased to announce a special Journal Track for MITA 2025, in collaboration with the Journal of Multimedia Information System (JMIS).

Dual Publication Track

Papers submitted to this track will undergo peer review for potential publication in JMIS. Authors of accepted papers will be invited to give oral presentations at MITA 2025, and only the abstracts will appear in the MITA proceedings. Full papers will be published in JMIS.

Go to JMIS Submission Site (Ensure to select 'MITA 2025 Journal Track' as submission type)

call-for-papers/call-for-workshop.title: Call for Workshop
call-for-papers/call-for-workshop.content:
Call for Workshop Proposals

We are soliciting proposals for workshops to be held together with MITA 2025.

  • Proposal Deadline: April 11, 2025
  • Notification: April 18, 2025
  • Submission Email: kmms1@kmms.or.kr

important-dates.title: Important Dates
important-dates.content: Check the important dates for the conference (Note the extended deadlines).

keynote.title: Keynote Speakers
keynote.content:
Keynote Speakers

Prof. Hyun Myung (KAIST)

Spatial AI and Autonomous Robot Navigation Technology

Prof. Mikio Hasegawa (Tokyo University of Science)

Applications of Complex Communication Sciences in Next Generation Wireless Communication Systems

Prof. Dan Dongseong Kim (University of Queensland)

Advances in Cybersecurity Modeling and Analysis: Methods, Applications, and Lessons Learned

Prof. Byoung Chul Ko (Keimyung University)

The Present and Future of Explainable AI (XAI): Toward Trustworthy Artificial Intelligence

program.title: Program
program.content: Detailed program will be announced closer to the conference date.

submission.title: Submission
submission.content:
Submission Link: Microsoft CMT MITA2025

Papers of MITA 2025, based on the peer review process, will be published in the proceedings of Communications in Computer and Information Science (CCIS) series by Springer.

venue-hotel.title: Venue & Hotel
venue-hotel.content:
Grand Hyatt Jeju

12 Noyeon-ro, Jeju-si, Korea.Rep

Transportation

Located approximately 3.5 kilometers from Jeju International Airport (CJU).

  • Taxi: About 10 minutes from the airport. Ask for 'Grand Hyatt Jeju' or 'Jeju Dream Tower'.
  • Public Bus: Routes 316, 465, etc. Alight at Wonnohyeong stop.

committee.name: Byung Gyu Kim (Sookmyung Women’s University, S.Korea)
